Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2010 09:44AM nicole1 wrote: I think you do have to go with your gut feeling as to where you will have surgery.  I did so much research when my niece fought her battle and was able to find out that there are wonderful centers all over the country.  Anderson in TX is a top center, Moffett in Tampa to name a couple.  And of course many in teh Boston area.  My niece also dealt with a holistic doctor as well, and I personally thought that she helped a lot.  My niece was DX at stage 4.  It was found in her liver first.  Very different from the women here.  Her husband felt that she should try anything and at first she did., but she did not believe in all the holistic things.  What I will say is that she was diong well until she stopped taking the holistic meds.  She went down hill very quickly after that.  it si an alternative that we can all look into. I guess I am rambling.  My husband called the breast center today and they told him that my results will be ready today.  My heart is racing to I tool an adavin to calm me down.  Good luck Keno41 with your treatment.  ilene
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2010 08:01AM nicole1 wrote: I had a core biopsy on Thursday morning Feb. 18th after a mamagram, dx mamagram and ultrasound.  Whatever they found was quite small, could be 0.5cm which is the size of a pea.  The doctor said that she thought that it looked OK but would biopsy to be sure.  She seemed very sure that it woudl come back B9.  She rated it a 4 and said that she had no choice as a 3 could not be biopsied.  Was this because I lost it before the second mamagram?  I have a family history of cancer on my father's side of the family and my beautiful niece passed away a year ago at age 33 from stage 4 breast cancer.  Hers was DX at stage 4.  The thought of having to break bad news to my mother who has lost so much is too hard to evven think about.  What I don't understand is how can the doc be sosure that it is not cancer and if so why do the biopsy?  I am feeling much of what all of you have expressed, but confused based on what I read.  They keep telling me that if she thought it was cancer she woudl have talked to me about getting in touch with a surgeon.  The waiting stinks, and it goes on.  I found this site this morning and have been reading and it seems that most of you that have cancer have at least found it early.  For the rest of us I hope we all get our B9 calls.  IF anyone has had an experience like mine I would love  to hear from you.  Take care, Ilene
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2010 08:19PM nicole1 wrote: Horsewing, I hope you get good news. Ilene On another note, if there is anyone out there who is interested in reading up on studies on diet and its effects on health a great book is The China Study.   Not a book to read cover to cover, but a good reference book.  This is not a book about cancer, I found it to be a great resource when I was researching to find something to help my niece.  Just thought I would throw this out to anyone who might be interested.
Posts.Title: Waiting for core biopsy results and scared nancyjg nicole1

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2010 08:45AM nicole1 wrote: Lisa,\ Thank you for getting back to me.  The waiting continues.  It seems so cruel that we are all asked to wait for so long.   I have found this site helpful.  I hope all the women here who are waiting are lucky to get a B9. And for those who have nto gotten that, I hope that they have the support that they need for their treatment and have positive outcomes.   Ilene

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2010 10:40AM nicole1 wrote: I just got my results from my cone biopsy and it came bak B9,  I think all of you who have been so supportive throughout this.  I am one of the lucky ones.  I pray the the rest of you get the same kind of news that I just did.  My doctor felt that it was B9 and she was right.  I will check in to this site to offer words of encouragement for other women going through this .  Good luck to all of you and thank you for being here. Ilene

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2010 11:34AM nicole1 wrote: Rosemary, The waiting is not easy.  I had a cone biopsy last Thursday, still waiting.  I have a wonderful mother who I cannot share this with unless I have to.  My brother died 3  1/2 years ago from brain cancer, his daughter died 30 years ago at age 7 from secondary brain cancer and there is more that I wont' go into.  My mother has lost so much that I can't even say anything at this point.  I hope I never have to.  Lists like this are the bes because we have all been through the waiting part.  I think friends tell you don't worry it will be OK.  Not sure that helps.  You are in my thoughts. Ilene
Posts.Title: Scared and Alone Rosemary349 Rosemary349

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2010 11:35PM nicole1 wrote: Have any of you looked into holistic care as well as conventional care?   I am reading a book called the China Study.  It is a good resource book that explains with research to back it up, how food affects our health.  I do not have breast cancer, but I do have a family history of breast and other cancers.  I feel that knowledge is power, so I do lots of reading.  If you are open to all sorts of ideas, this may be a good book for you to get.  Ilene
